titleStmt.title: Paul J. Rattigan to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG12041

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.collection: 37th - 76th Regiments Enrolled Militia Primary Source Documents (1861-1866)
msIdentifier.idno: Box 81, Folder 862-64 MONTGOMERY COUNTY Recruiting & Raising Company 73d Rgt. Ky. Militia

body.p:
Mt Sterling Ky. 14" Sep' 1864
To
His Excellency
Thos, E. Bramlette,
Frankfort. Ky
Sir

I beg to inform your Excellency that I believe I can raize a Company of Men for Train and Railroad protection: or, any other duty subject to your Excellency's order-- but-- unattached to any Regment-- if you will Commission me to do so,
I beg most respectfully to refer your Excellency to the following citizens of Lebanon Ky.
Messrs. L, A. Spaulding, Wick Ben -- Spaulding, Len Edlin, and William Brickin,

Most respectfully
Your Excellency's
Humble Servant
Paul. J. Rattigan

Ky State Guard
Mt. Sterling Ky
Septr 14th 1864
Rattigan Paul. J.
To the Gov. and referred
Asking authority to raise a Company for train or R. R. duty or any other. subject to the Govrnors order; but does not want to be attached to a Regt. Refers to divers gentlemen of Lebanon Ky.
